Integrate models and analytics in marketing practices
Guide our business strategy by identifying the target clientele (e.g., segments, location)
Integrate new practices (geolocation, triggering, personalization, behavioural, etc.) and develop the client experience with the business lines
Help convert our current analytical environment to a new cloud-based environment
Prioritize data asset development based on business priorities and analytical opportunities
Coordinate a team of 5 or 6 data scientists
Act as an expert with the Bank's internal stakeholders

Bachelor’s degree in a related field and 10 years of relevant experience, or a master’s degree in a related field and 8 years of relevant experience
Significant or specialized experience using banking data (transactional, credit, investment, etc.)
Experience managing a team of data scientists
Experience with SAS, Python, Databricks and Snowflake
Proven leadership in implementing initiatives that generate growth in the banking industry
Ability to influence and manage change
Ability to manage stakeholders
Strong analytical mindset
Experience managing high-performance team(s) in business intelligence
Bilingualism, spoken and written (English and French)

Job Title: Senior Program Manager, Mobility, Transportation and AI
Job Description:
About MaRS

MaRS Discovery District (@MaRSDD) in Toronto is the one of the world's largest urban innovation hubs.

MaRS supports promising high-growth companies to scale their businesses globally, while tackling key societal challenges in areas such as Health, Cleantech, Finance, Transportation, AI, and others. In addition to helping start-ups launch, grow and scale, the MaRS community is dedicated to cross-disciplinary collaboration, commercialization of discoveries, and driving ideas to impact.
This job is about helping Canadian entrepreneurs launch, grow and scale world-beating companies in mobility and transportation, with a focus on AI-powered startups.
About MaRS

MaRS Discovery District ( @MaRSDD ) in Toronto is the one of the world's largest urban innovation hubs. MaRS supports promising startups tackling key societal and industry challenges across Health, Cleantech, Fintech, Enterprise Software, Mobility, and Advanced Manufacturing. In addition to helping startups launch, grow and scale, the MaRS community is dedicated to cross-disciplinary collaboration, commercialization of discoveries and driving ideas to impact.

This role resides within the Venture Services group at MaRS. Venture Services works with over 1000 innovation-driven science and technology startups. Venture Services helps entrepreneurs commercialize innovations with high business growth potential in Canada and globally by facilitating access to the customer, talent, funding, marketing and stakeholder connections required to successfully scale their business.
Context

MaRS hosts the Toronto regional technology site for AVIN , a program designed to reinforce Ontario's position as a North American leader in transportation technology and infrastructure systems. Our program members work on products related to connected and autonomous vehicles (C/AVs) and intelligent transportation systems (ITS), all underpinned by artificial intelligence and machine learning. Solutions span autonomous vehicle perception and control systems, vehicle cybersecurity, electric vehicle infrastructure, real-time vehicle routing, automotive manufacturing defect prediction, and more.
About your Role

You will be responsible for managing the design, implementation, business development, and partnership development of the AVIN program and related initiatives that accelerate venture commercialization of Connected and Autonomous Vehicles and Intelligent Transportation Systems.
What You'll Be Doing

AVIN Program Delivery

Manage the AVIN Toronto Regional Technology Development Site (RTDS) by facilitating:

Business Support : Onboarding and managing the relationship with our cohort of C/AV and ITS venture companies, ensuring all clients fully leverage relevant MaRS resources including business advisory, technical advisory, market research, and industry partner services.

Events : Creating thought leadership content and supporting the startup community by designing and hosting multiple events on a quarterly basis relevant to the auto-tech sector in collaboration with partners, clients, and experts from industry and academia.
Community and Co-Working : Designing and running the "MaRS Beta" Slack community and co-working space in the MaRS Centre for participating venture companies and partner organizations, working closely with the MaRS Real Estate team

Data and Tools Access : Managing the delivery and growth of the AVIN Data Index, an online product that provides a central location for sharing auto-tech datasets and tools relevant to the venture companies and partner organizations.

AVIN Business and Partnership Development

Increase participating members in AVIN and fulfill contractual requirements
Participate in speaking engagements and other activities to attract new C/AV and ITS ventures
Conduct business development activities to acquire and engage with new industry partners who provide key tools, resources and funding for the C/AV and ITS ventures in the program

Funding Partner Liaison and AVIN Reporting

Be the key liaison between MaRS and our funding partner Ontario Centre of Innovation (OCI), representing MaRS at the OCI AVIN Hub and other AVIN regional sites
Coordinate semi-annual surveys of participating venture companies
Prepare detailed semi-annual reports in close collaboration with MaRS finance, tracking venture company progress, partner contributions and MaRS contributions towards the program, and program spending against budget.
Represent the Toronto RTDS provincially. Prepare monthly community reports for OCI / AVIN and quarterly or semi-annual community presentations.

Mobility/Transportation and Smart City Strategy

Contribute to MaRS' broader strategies for mobility/transportation and smart cities, including identifying opportunities and needs for future areas of investment, identifying and pursuing partnership opportunities with Business Development, and working with peers in Venture Services and Partner Solutions Group teams to design strategic initiatives in these areas

What You Bring

Minimum undergraduate degree, preferably in Engineering, Computer Sciences, or Technology Degree, or Business or Program Management
5+ years experience in program management or project management
5+ years experience in partnership development
Strong customer focus and empathy, so that you can internalize client and partner needs and ensure the program design meets those needs
Familiarity with emerging next generation network technologies, including automotive technologies, Artificial Intelligence, 5G, IoT, and Cloud Computing. You need medium-high understanding of relevant technologies and applications / use cases, and passion/drive to proactively seek out and learn more.
Ability to manage multiple large-scale and complex projects with contractual milestones
Understanding of basic startup principles and stages
Strong communication skills – oral, written and presentation, with excellent interpersonal skills
Strong relationship management abilities, managing multiple stakeholders with minimal need for guidance
Excellent organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills
Experience with event planning and delivery
Budget planning and management experience
Professional demeanor, able to represent the organization in all circumstances
Self-motivated/self-driven and able to work independently or as a team member
Strategic thinker

Great to have (but not required)

2+ years of experience in product development
Experience working with one or more of the following industry areas: automotive, telecommunications, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence
Experience supporting startups in an incubator/accelerator environment (or equivalent) as a support staff and/or advisor
Experience preparing government reports and financial forecasts
Technical or industry knowledge in automotive, or IoT, or AI communications and software
Venture coaching experience
Business Development experience

MaRS Discovery District is committed to diversity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates, including aboriginal persons, francophones, members of sexual minority groups, persons with disabilities, visible minorities and women. We will provide any requested accommodation to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.

Applications are due by Wednesday June 30, 2021
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada and reside in Ontario.

We are a purpose-driven organization on a mission to make the world a better place through inclusive innovation. This commitment to inclusion, equity and diversity are core to who we are and what we believe and, as such, encourage applications from members of diverse identity groups, including those who have been historically excluded and marginalized. You are welcome at MaRS.

We want you to be as successful throughout our recruitment process as possible. Please get in touch with us if there's anything we can do to make your experience more accessible and inclusive, including accommodations for differing (dis)abilities.
Applications are due by 11:59 PM on the closing date stated above.
Applications received after this time will not be considered.

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Bell is making unmatched investments in our world-leading broadband fibre and wireless networks because we know they’re the backbone of the products and services our customers love. If you’re excited about transforming the way people connect, our Network team is the right place for you.

About Us:
Big Data and AI are one of the fastest growing business and technology disciplines. Specifically in Telecom Voice services, there are great opportunities to utilize vast amounts of data to enable enhanced services and to evolve network planning, engineering and operation using Big Data, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Bell’s Voice Wireline Network Orchestration and Data Insights (Voice WNODI) is a relatively new team focused on utilizing Big Data, advanced analytics and machine learning technologies to enable Bell’s AI powered networks. This is a rare opportunity for seasoned data and analytics professional to join our fast growing team of Big Data experts and data scientists to design and develop data solutions to support the Bell Voice network and shape the future of Bell’s AI capabilities.

Position Description:
As a member of the Voice WNODI team , you will play a leading role in proactively analyzing, designing, engineering Network Big Data and AI/ML solutions to address the business needs of the Bell’s Voice planning and operations teams.

Job Duties/Accountabilities:
Lead a virtual team of data scientists and data engineers in the design, development and deployment of AI-enabled solutions to address complex business problems
Ensure proper usage of state of the art big data technologies to meet business goals in line with internal architectural guideline
Identify and evaluate future technologies that may have a significant impact on the environment or technology by improving performance and efficiency, decreasing costs, or enabling new revenue sources
Research and recommend architectural solutions to complex business problems that can benefit from the use of AI/ML tools and techniques
Apply expertise and leadership in technical solutions, work closely with solution providers, product management, enterprise architects, data engineers and data scientists.
End to end thinking to proactively consider customer experience and operational support in their designs/architecture
Ability to bring together cross-functional teams across Network, Information Technology and others to collaborate, design and deliver Use Cases/Solutions that create business value for Bell
Ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines

Qualifications/Competencies:
A Bachelors or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or equivalent
5+ years architectural experience preferably in a data environment
Knowledge and expertise in designing data platforms and solutions
Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithms and approaches
Experience in enterprise data modeling, data normalization
Experience with data collection and streaming, e.g. Kafka, Logstash, Rsyslog
Experience working with Big Data / Hadoop (preferably Cloudera) environments
Experience developing solutions using Java/Scala, Python
Experience working with CI/CD tools and approaches
Advanced skills with SQL and database systems, e.g. Impala, Hive, Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, etc.
Familiarity working with web services, REST and APIs including SOAP/XML protocol and RESTful APIs
Exposure to analytics tools as Microstrategy, Tableau, Looker, etc.
Highly analytical skills and ability to work with large and complex technical data sets
Ability to work within an agile setting
Self-starter who is comfortable working with and presenting to all management levels
Good business acumen to ensure technical solutions are created with business focus
Very good analytical capabilities as well as organizational, interpersonal and communication skills are necessary (written, verbal and presentation skills)

Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:
Experience working in the Telecommunications or Media industries is an asset
Played a leading role in the delivery of multiple end-to-end projects
Is easily acquainted to new technologies
Telecom Operations and Engineering knowledge (wireless, wireline and TV/Media networks)
Bilingual (French and English)
Programming/Software Development experience
Knowledge of ML technologies and techniques

#LI-CC2

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.

Are you looking for a new challenge? Our Digital Employee Experience team is looking for a People Insights Manager!
What will your typical day look like?
In FY20, the Chief People and Culture Office (CCPO) developed a Culture and People Strategy for 2023 – a roadmap that will guide enablement of the broader firm Category of One strategy by inspiring and empowering our people and delivering “I only could have done it at Deloitte” experiences. We are looking for an individual that is technical, creative, curious, a self-starter, thrives in ambiguity and is passionate about uncovering insights. The ideal candidate is very comfortable working with large sets of data to discover trends and formulate insights using various people data sources, as well as creating recommendations using internal and external market data. This individual will work closely with other CCPO team members, other enabling areas (e.g., ITS, Finance, etc.) and our business partners on a regular basis.

The People Insights Manager is accountable to:
Lead the development of advanced data models using statistical and analytical techniques and toolsets in Python to solve business problems and provide data-driven insights
Ability to leverage analytical tools to organize and analyze data for ad-hoc requests and regular insights reporting
Lead the project lifecycle of key analytics and digital projects; from identification through to development and execution
Explore unknown data, brainstorm new ideas to uncover causality and hidden correlations to drive business insights that enable decisions
Support the evolution of the People Insights strategy to meet evolving business needs, as well as help prioritize and plan the portfolio of projects to realize the strategy
Collaborate with core team members including the Strategic Workforce Planning Manager, Digital Experience Manager, and Digital Programs Manager to execute projects; providing subject matter advisory to achieve results
Lead teams in the execution of key programs by leveraging flexible pool of delivery experts and partnering with collaborating functions (e.g., IT, Finance etc.)
Be a key point of contact for the ‘voice of our people’ and other key people-related insights
About the team
The Digital Employee Experience team supports the firm’s ambition to innovate towards a technology-enabled future. This team will advance the use of key enablers (e.g., machine-based capabilities, data-driven decision-making, automation, integrated tools) and evolve digital practices to support CPO strategy and experience through the augmentation of human skillsets with digital capabilities and solutions. Through the digitization of practices, and standardization of approach to reporting and analytics performed by the team, the Culture and People Office team will accelerate in digital maturity and improve in speed and quality of decision-making.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who has expertise in the following areas:
3-5 years’ experience in a role that required knowledge in Data Analytics and/or Data Science
Strong experience with statistical analytical techniques, data mining, machine learning, and predictive models using Python (pandas, scikit-learn, statsmodels, etc)
Strong theoretical understanding of regression models relevant to econometric analysis
MA/MSc degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is an asset
Comfortable working with large sets of data with ability to merge various data sources to uncover trends and integrate into meaningful reports and recommendations
Ability to clearly communicate and draw conclusions with data in order to answer business questions
Ability to deliver information in a presentation in a clear and concise manner
Database and programming languages experience and data manipulation and integration skills using SQL, Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL Databases, or similar tools
Ability to quickly learn new technology/software/systems; understanding of HR technology, systems, HR data and reporting and experience with HRIS and reporting/ data visualization tools an asset
Project management experience, including juggling multiple projects, stakeholders, timelines, etc.
Strong communication and presentation skills (verbal, written and visual)
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships
Enjoys working in an agile and collaborative environment
Experience supporting leadership with a desire to work and grow within a People (HR) organization
Experience with natural language processing and optimization is an asset
Professional services, consulting, or advisory experience is an asset
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You?

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

As a Senior Data Analyst at Vendasta you will ask questions and discover meaningful answers that drive Vendasta’s growth and success.

The Senior Data Analyst will work closely with leadership teams in sales, success, product, and more to develop robust research questions and contribute to all steps of the data analysis process, including hypothesis generation, exploring and cleaning data, modelling/interpreting/communicating results, and measuring their implementation. Finally, they will leverage the interdepartmental analyst group to review, develop, and share information or analyses that help one another learn and grow in data & business intelligence, as well as help the company grow and evolve. The selected candidate must enjoy coordinating with interdisciplinary teams, learn quickly, and be comfortable working independently!

Responsibilities
Respond to ad hoc requests from various stakeholders
Follow Vendasta’s analysis workflow
Hypothesis Generation: Work with stakeholders to refine and transform questions into hypotheses
Exploratory Data Analysis: Gather, clean, and explore large data sets
Model Building: Create a visual and/or mathematical representation of the real world
Interpret Results: Understand the conclusions that can be reached and know the implications
Communicate Results: Deliver findings to stakeholders
Follow-up: Ensure that the data was effectively implemented and measure results
Build, maintain & monitor internal dashboards for each department to track productivity, revenue, quality, staffing patterns, expenses, efficiency metrics and more
Provide prompt reports on monthly, quarterly, and yearly information
Provide analytical support and identify business trends that require action
Review and critique other’s analysis
Develop and foster a working relationship with other analysts, software developers, product managers, sales, marketing, and executive
Become the expert in multiple data sources and create/implement innovative and sustainable solutions
Participate in process improvement initiatives and assist in automating processes currently requiring manual efforts

Skills & Qualifications
3-5 years experience in data analysis or science
Demonstrated expertise with databases and various querying techniques (SQL, NoSQL, API)
Strong understanding of statistical inference and descriptive statistics
Demonstrated ability to retrieve and clean data by whatever means is necessary
Proven ability to analyze and report information
Well developed communication and presentation skills
Ability to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously while working in a dynamic environment subject to impromptu changes in schedules and priorities
Strong initiative—establish goals and take responsibility for meeting them within defined timelines

1+ years of hand-on modeling experience in the area of predictive modeling, NLP, personalization, recommendation system
Deep understanding of statistical modeling and deep learning techniques.
Strong problem solving ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills and data presentation skills.
1 year experience in Python and SQL
About Us

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Amazon Science gives you insight into the company’s approach to customer focused scientific innovation. Amazon fundamentally believes that scientific innovation is essential to being the most customer-centric company in the world. It’s the company’s ability to have an impact at scale that allows us to attract some of the brightest minds in artificial intelligence and related fields. Our scientists continue to publish, teach, and engage with the academic community, in addition to utilizing our working backwards method to enrich the way we live and work.

Please visit https://www.amazon.science for more information.

Are you interested in helping Amazon ensure that customers make great purchase decisions and that the world's most recognized Brands using Amazon are successful listing and selling their products? The Brand Protection team designs and builds high performance software systems using machine learning that identify and prevent abuse on behalf of brand owners worldwide.

We are looking for a highly talented scientist to help build of our vision for Brand Protection. As a applied scientist on the team, you will interface directly with Product and Engineer to build hands of the wheel solutions to determine how Selling Partners (e.g. Third Party Sellers and Retail Vendors) list on our catalog. You will work backwards from data insights and customer feedback to build the right machine learning solutions, and resourceful in finding innovative solutions to unsolved problems.

This is a global role that will include interaction with Brands, Sellers and internal teams in countries outside of the United States, requiring a strong ability to communicate effectively and understand the different needs of global customers. You should have extensive experience leading multiple Machine Learning initiatives, from conception to launch in a rapidly evolving environment. Amazon’s growth requires leaders who move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit to create new solutions, have an unrelenting tenacity to get things done, and are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems.

Major responsibilities:
Understand business challenges by analyzing data and customer feedback
Collaborate with tech and product teams on model building strategies and model experiment, implementation and continuous improvement
Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data to design strategies to solve business problems.
Use CV, NLP and state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to create scalable solutions for business problems
Create business and analytics reports and present to the senior management teams
Research and implement novel machine learning and statistical approaches
3 years of hand-on modeling experience in the area of Deep Learning, NLP or Computer Vision
Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and project planning/execution skills including estimating and scheduling.
Ability and willingness to multi-task and learn new technologies quickly.
Familiar with AWS machine learning technologies such as SageMaker.
Strong program skills in C/C++, Java, and/or matlab

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Senior Data Analyst - Mobility is an expert on digital and CRM data that supports reporting requests leveraging data management and other established standards and best practices. Requires experience in Google Analytics 360, bringing its data to the enterprise and reporting on it through Microsoft Power BI, Excel, SQL.
CHALLENGES TO BE MET
Drive the tagging & taxonomy expertise, definition, publication, and implementation for digital assets. Manage adoption and adherence to set rules to ensure the right digital data is captured for reporting & analytics.
Translate business goals, initiatives, campaigns into
implementation steps for the iOS developers
actionable metrics with baseline targets (e.g., engagement, sales, impact, return on investments, etc.)
Develop, deploy, and manage self-serve analytics reports/dashboards (e.g., Google Analytics 360, Power BI Reports/Dashboards, Excel Spreadsheets, etc.) for operations.
Engineer reusable common data models and pipelines from disparate sources.
Ensure data collection, preparation and processing are accurate, devoid of biases, integrated, orchestrated, and executed as planned.
Develop, define, document and maintain data schema, dictionary, structure, pipelines and their business use (e.g., taxonomy, tagging, etc.).
Develop optimized code, methods, and algorithms to perform the analytics work using the right enterprise technologies.
Build and manage relationships with internal clients and partners to provide value and ensure ongoing alignment. Collaborate with data analysts / experts in other teams or external consultants.
Understand context quickly and respond rapidly to requests on campaign reporting using data from Google Analytics and CRM.
Analyze for causality using explainable models. Advise on potential improvements to business practices based on data and insights through storytelling. Assist with machine learning solutions for business problems.

Manage activities and tasks from planning to delivery.
Take ownership of work and collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., marketing, IT, digital) to ensure well-communicated and timely delivery.
Actively participate in planning, status, and governance sessions.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
7 to 15 years of relevant work experience driving digital analytics initiatives with cross-functional teams, advising executives on metrics definition, performance management or strategic orientation.
Results-focused self-starter with excellent analytical skills and an ability to decompose ambiguous questions into discrete data problems and answer with clear, actionable insights.
Experience implementing digital analytics for native applications for 3+ years including writing tech specs, assisting app developers with implementation (iOS and Android) and testing.
Experience working in an agile environment.
Experience with web analytics, CRM data and their ingestion, transformation and reporting.
Bachelor’s degree or experience in Analytics, Management of Information Systems, Computer Sciences, Engineering, E-Commerce, Strategy, Finance or Marketing disciplines. Graduate degree considered an asset.
Experience with Google Analytics 360, Tealium, other web analytics technologies, and mobile site and mobile app analytics platforms.
Digital marketing platform skills including widely used ad serving and technology platforms, social listening platforms for apps and common digital analytics platforms including the following: Tealium, Google Analytics, Analytics Canvas, Firebase and Big Query.
Familiarity with native apps development environments and metrics (e.g., app store, SDK, languages, etc.).
Ability to aggregate, standardize, interpret and model data, and to work independently within a data warehouse or decentralized environment.

Excel skills (pivots, tables, functions, data modeling, Power Query).
Familiarity with visualization methods and dashboard tools or modern business intelligence tools (e.g., Microsoft Power BI).
Analytic modeling using methods such as hypothesis-based testing, statistics, software-assisted segmentation and linear regression.
Very strong ability to produce and communicate polished and crisp reports, analyses, presentations autonomously.
Organizational skills and ability to own and manage several tasks and initiatives at once. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.

Very strong interpersonal and communication skills and cross-functional collaboration to work with partners to achieve common objectives and commitments.

thinkRF has an opportunity for a Senior AI/ Machine Learning Engineer who can provide technical leadership and innovation to support the next stage in our company’s growth. In this role, you would be responsible for delivering AI / Machine Learning based solutions for thinkRF’s customers as well as creating and maintaining a fast paced development architecture using leading AI technology frameworks.
The Company
thinkRF is a rapidly growing Ottawa based technology company that is the leader in developing software-defined spectrum analysis platforms that monitor, detect and analyze complex waveforms in today’s rapidly evolving wireless landscape.
Founded in 2006, thinkRF is headquartered in Ottawa, Canada with offices and partners globally.
The Opportunity
thinkRF has an opportunity for a Senior AI/ Machine Learning Engineer who can provide technical leadership and innovation to support the next stage in our company’s growth. In this role, you would be responsible for delivering AI / Machine Learning based solutions for thinkRF’s customers as well as creating and maintaining a fast paced development architecture using leading AI technology frameworks.
The position is based in Ottawa, and under current COVID-19 conditions has flexibility to work from home however, there will be times when it is required to work from our office in Kanata.
Responsibilities
As the Senior AI / ML Engineer / Architect, you will manage multiple AI/Analytic product initiatives and be the primary engineer/architect responsible for key tasks such as requirements analysis, AI / ML techniques selection and optimization, data capture processes, AI architecture design and ongoing management and a maintenance.
Using your industry experience, you will plan the implementation of AI based solutions, choosing the right technologies and evaluating the evolution of the architecture as required. As the Senior AI/ML Engineer Architect, you will play a major role in implementing and managing the AI/ML development environment using Cloud and on-premise products & services.
In this role, you will:
Design working prototypes and proof of concepts to fine tune customer solutions
Produce and validate reference architecture implementations across multiple market segments and RF/AI use cases
Act as a technical liaison between customers and the product teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback
Manage the day-to-day activities of the AI work activities and lead the AI/ML deliverables within an Agile/Scrum environment
Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management
Be a part of a highly productive and creative engineering team
Qualifications
Essential Qualifications
BS in Computer Science, data science or an AI-related discipline
5+ years of technical expertise within major AI or software-centric programs in industry, academia, or government
Proven track record of implementing Machine Learning solutions, development in multiple languages and statistical analysis and well experienced with a whole host of other approaches used in practical applications of machine learning
Deep learning tools: Tensorflow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras, Python Libraries
Proficiency in Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning & Modeling: CNNs, LSTMs, GANs, Autoencoders, Reinforcement Learning, Temporal use-cases as well as classical AI techniques
Data science and data engineering of structured and unstructured data as well as imbalanced data structures, handling Peta-byte scale datasets for model training, proficiency in distributed computing and databases
Familiarity with software development on AWS including serverless development experience including complex integrations with AWS Lambda, Amazon Elasticsearch, Amazon Redshift, Amazon Kinesis, and Amazon DynamoDB
Assets
Masters / PhD in Computer or Data Science
Domain expertise in Machine Learning Techniques associated within the RF/Wireless communications domain
Proficiency in development methods and techniques
Agile methodology: Scrum, Kanban, Sprints, Collaboration tools: Wiki or other
Version control systems: Git, GitLab, GitHub, Bitbucket
Continuous Integration: Jenkins
Working understanding of embedded processor control of RF functions and a good understanding of RF Engineering domain
Proficiency in DevOps / MLOps Cloud infrastructure: OpenStack, AWS (Amazon Web Services), Azure, Google Cloud, Virtual Environments, Cloud Containers: Docker, Kubernetes
Personal Attributes
Self-starter, capable of taking initiative to identify and resolve problems, and improve work environment
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
Outstanding work ethic and commitment to organizational success.
Team player who is able to build consensus and work cooperatively
Ability to successfully deliver on committed project deadlines
Why work for us?
At thinkRF, highly skilled, creative and dynamic professionals join our team because they have the opportunity to work alongside technology thought leaders while directly contributing to the delivery of our world-class technology. We offer our employees a competitive total rewards package, ongoing development opportunities and a flexible work environment.
To join the thinkRF team:
Email your resume in confidence to hr@thinkrf.com, specifying the title of the position you are applying for in the subject line of your message. Please be sure to provide some insight into your initiative, skills and achievements, and how you plan to contribute toward the growth of our company.
thinkRF is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, origins, ages, orientations, genders, creeds and religions. thinkRF accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process, and beyond. If contacted regarding your application to this position, please advise us of any accommodations you may require.

What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. Machine learning / High Performance Compute Roadmap Program Manager

Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer Cyber Security (Calgary, Los Altos...
Job Description:
Machine Learning Engineer Cyber Security (Calgary, Los Altos, CA or Seattle, WA)
vArmour is the leading provider of Application Relationship Management. Enterprises around the world rely on vArmour to control operational risk and increase application resiliency for their multi-cloud environments - all while leveraging the technology they already own. Based in Los Altos, CA, the company is backed by top investors including Highland Capital Partners, AllegisCyber, NightDragon, Redline Capital, Citi Ventures, and Telstra.
Only vArmour is able to build out a relationship-based map of applications and users across the enterprise, regardless of the underlying infrastructure. As businesses continue to tackle the challenges of digital transformation, this deepened visibility into every environment means businesses can map relationships across their entire dynamic enterprise in one view. This equips security and operations teams with unprecedented control to address user access risks, achieve Zero Trust objectives, meet compliance, or discover the blast radius of an incident.
At vArmour, “Relationships Matter” is the cornerstone philosophy that drives the company. It shows itself in the technology and in how the company enables hundreds of enterprises around the globe to understand the relationships within and across their estates to optimize risk and resiliency. This value is taken to heart as well in how the company treats people, whether they’re customers, partners or fellow employees. The company believes that together we are stronger and better. This is why Relationships Matter at vArmour.
What you’ll do
You will be responsible for formulating and implementing statistical techniques and predictive machine learning algorithms upon our rich application datasets
Creating data workflows using object oriented project development with Python, providing our customers with unique insight into how their applications should be secured in the multicloud world
You will be proficient in manipulation, aggregation, and transformation of huge datasets and be comfortable with recommending technical data architecture and pipelines to optimize data management at scale
You will work with our customers, marketing team and software engineers to innovate new workflows, algorithms, and brilliant security insights, revolutionizing the way application security is achieved in the cloud
You will work in vibrant Scrum teams, where you will advocate for best practices and adoption of software design patterns
Explore new technologies and learn new skills to continuously improve the way we operate
What you’ll bring
Proven track record as machine learning engineer/developer covering large scale data analytics, modeling, and data mining (preferably in the cyber security domain)
Experience with ML applied to one or more of graph datasets, networks, bipartite graphs, and community detection techniques such as Louvain
Proficient in one or more disciplines, including statistics, clustering algorithms like t-SNE, machine learning, markov models, and belief networks
Proven track record of working within a collaborative development organization delivering world class software solutions
Ability to prototype and develop enterprise grade analytics in Python
Working knowledge of SQL, databases, and data manipulation / exploration with bonus points for experience of data architecture design, particularly in pipeline processing and graph database schema
You will hold a Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or Operations Research) with 3+ years experience in a similar roles
You have prior experience with modern Python-based ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow)
Experience in cybersecurity and/or computer networking would be an asset
Bonus points for experience and knowledge in natural language processing or IaC (Infrastructure as Code)
Perks
Competitive salary, pre-IPO stock options, and flexible PTO
Great culture and team spirit (virtual yoga, guest speakers, happy hour)
Full benefits (health/dental/vision/disability)
Company paid Life Insurance and AD&D
Team celebrations
The interview process will include a technical sample project (take home, approx. 3 hours) to assess finalist candidates.
vArmour is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive workforce.
No agencies
Job Type: Full-time

Job Title: Director of AI and Data Science
Job Description:
Overview
Founded in 2013, Perimeter Medical Imaging AI, Inc (TSXV: PINK) is a Toronto-based medical device company with U.S. Headquarters in Dallas, Texas. Perimeter is developing advanced imaging tools that allow surgeons, radiologists, and pathologists to visualize subsurface microscopic tissue structures during a clinical procedure, as well as advanced artificial intelligence/machine learning image assessment tools intended to increase the efficiency of image review. We are passionate about working with end users to develop imaging tools which are easy to use and meet real clinical needs.
Job Description
As the Director of AI and Data Science, you will develop and execute on a technical strategy to advance the company’s AI products. This will include identifying novel approaches to leveraging the latest in machine learning and artificial intelligence to analyze medical images of various excised tissue types, to accelerate and enhance clinician identification of clinically-relevant regions of interest. You will develop and oversee execution of a plan which includes: user requirements generation, technical approach, clinical data needs, data analysis pipeline, tool validation, and eventual verification and validation approach for new algorithm products. The ideal candidate has successfully built an AI program for a medical device company, leading to regulatory clearance and clinical adoption of AI-based product(s).
Major Responsibilities:
Operate as a thought leader and visionary, with the ability to guide, influence and inspire peak performance, innovation and adoption of the latest engineering practices
Lead the team responsible for algorithm development, including analysis and annotation of clinical data for training, validation and test
Partner with business and technical leaders to identify and solve for specific data and resourcing for ongoing and future product development opportunities
Develop strategy for testing algorithm performance, including standalone / benchtop methods for evaluating impact of changes to algorithm performance
Support the software development team in transitioning prototype models into production-level code, testing and validation, as well as design and implementation of software infrastructure needed to drive algorithm research and development
Support interactions with regulatory bodies and drafts content for regulatory submissions
Other tasks as assigned.
Minimal Qualifications:
Masters or Ph.D. in bioinformatics, machine learning, computational science, or related fields, or equivalent industry experience
7+ years of product development experience in a regulated environment
Proven leader with 5+ years managing teams as well as attracting and recruiting technical talent
Experience developing one or more product(s) which incorporate artificial intelligence and/or machine learning algorithms
Experience working with machine learning workflows in python
Fluency (written and spoken) in English language
Highly Desired Skills:
Experience working under a medical device quality management system (ISO 13485 and/or 21 CFR QSR)
Experience with IEC 62304, IEC 62366, ISO 14971
Experience with clinical evidence generation to support product validation and regulatory submissions
Job Type
Full-time
Location
Toronto or Texas (primarily remote)
Does this look like a good fit for you? Tell us more…
To apply for this role, please email us your resume and (optional) cover letter with “Director of AI and Data Science” in the subject line to: emunro@perimetermed.com

Perimeter Medical Imaging AI is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. Perimeter welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Please let us know if you require disability-related accommodation or other grounds protected by human rights legislation during the recruitment process so that we can work with you to meet your needs.

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data. As part of our Data & Analytics (D&A) team, you'll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.

TD's vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you've been in business as long as we have, you know there's no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive D&A team is a massive part of that future achievement.

Job Description
You will lead the technical delivery of projects & work of up to 5 colleagues. Teams across the enterprise will rely on you to bring about holistic changes to the bank's business practices. Your knowledge and expertise in data science is complemented by strong business, communication and technical skills, allowing you to own & deliver with an integrated approach – seamlessly aligning with other leaders across the organization. You naturally provide your team with the inspiration and tools to execute with speed and precision, becoming true leaders themselves.

The following are key qualifications for a Data Scientist II:
Deep technical skills in multiple facets of data science: advanced analytics, statistical modelling, machine learning & data engineering
Advanced communication, business acumen and stakeholder management competencies
Accountable to lead & deliver complex, Agile, cross-functional projects that range widely in design, size, scale, scope and techniques
Work closely with stakeholders to identify opportunities and serve as an ambassador for data science across the enterprise
Liaise with support functions such as risk, technology, model validation, OCDO etc. and operate within TD’s risk appetite, following policies, protocols and procedures
A champion in the D&A community for TD’s platforms and strategies, proactively identifying opportunities to advance tools, techniques and approaches
Self-directed with the ability to identify meaningful work in down times and manage your time effectively in busy times
Take ownership of team targets and strategies such as value generation and contributes to the overall management and culture of the team, including setting an example for junior employees
Exceptional collaborator in a high-interaction environment
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Demonstrated track record leading major data science projects
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Advanced knowledge of industry data tools: python, R, SQL and Scala

Communitech was founded in 1997 by a group of entrepreneurs committed to making Waterloo Region a global innovation leader. At the time it was just a wild idea, but somehow this community managed to pull it off. Today, Communitech is a public-private innovation hub that supports a community of more than 1,600 companies — from startups to scale-ups to large global players.
Communitech helps tech companies start, grow and succeed in three distinct ways.
Communitech is a place – the centre of gravity for entrepreneurs and innovators. A clubhouse for building cool tech and great companies.
Communitech delivers programs – helping companies at all stages with access to capital, customers and talent. We are here to help them grow and innovate.
Communitech partners in building a world-leading ecosystem – making sure we have all the ingredients (and the brand) to help companies go from a small startup to a global giant.
We’re looking to add some amazing people to this team. People who believe in the Communitech mission and are willing to do what it takes to help our members succeed. If you think big, but are always willing to push a broom, then we’d love to hear from you. Wonder what it’s like to work at Communitech? The Data & Advanced Technologies (D&AT) Team is looking for a Director, Data Innovation Programming. The successful candidate will oversee the deployment of existing data innovation programming and develop new products and services as warranted that can help our member companies capitalize on internal and external data assets. The role will also require gathering input from our customers to understand the challenges they face and how Communitech can help them address these challenges. It will also require staying updated on the latest trends and technologies (AI, ML, Cloud computing, 5G, quantum) and the role these technologies do play, or will play, in constructing end-to-end data-driven and/or data-informed applications. This position will start on a contract with strong opportunity to transition to permanent for the right candidate.
What you’ll be doing:
Evaluation of current data innovation programming as it relates to the needs of our customers
As warranted, oversee the delivery of existing programming including data innovation workshops and data innovation canvas sessions
Sensing and research into market trends and emerging technologies and develop an understanding how they can translate value for our member companies
Develop use cases in priority industries that illustrates how companies are capitalizing on internal and/or external data assets
Using primary and secondary research resources, develop insights and validate needs of our customers to understand their challenges and identify ways we can help
Work with other teams within Communitech, especially the Corporate Innovation (CI) team and the Start & Scale team, to align DAT offerings across these customer segments and explore new offerings
Provide guidance and advice to the Communitech team for new technology and data
Contribute to BD efforts by supporting prospect calls and providing insight on D&AT capabilities at Communitech
Other duties as assigned. All duties subject to change

Qualifications:
10+ years of relevant experience in both an applied and strategic context
Technical background, especially in areas related to data innovation and related fields including data governance, privacy, & security
Strong project and partner management skills
Good presentation and workshop facilitation skills
The ability to navigate our full customer spectrum - from corporate senior management to startups and scale-ups
Understands how startup/SME growth works
Experience leading large scale data projects in a corporate environment
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Product development experience and experience in an innovation environment an asset

To Apply
Please apply online along with your resume and cover letter.
We thank all applicants in advance; however only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted. All applications will be kept confidential. Communitech is a diverse and inclusive environment and encourages applications from all qualified candidates, including aboriginal persons, francophones, members of sexual minority groups, persons with disabilities, visible minorities and women. We will provide any requested accommodation to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.

What is the Opportunity?
The Marketing Science team of Personal and Commercial Banking is looking for a passionate and innovative Senior Data Scientist. As a Data Scientist you will problem solve, analyze, design, implement and monitor machine learning applications using state of the art tools and algorithms. We are looking to maintain our position as the industry leader in deepening client relationships and engagement through the implementation of Next Best Offer Strategy. To achieve these goals, we leverage diverse data sources and a suite of domain specific algorithms.

What will you do?
Interact with RBC internal partners and lines of businesses to help them frame their use cases and define success metrics (Key Performance Indicators).
Prepare, parse and integrate large and varied structured and unstructured data for model training and scoring while preserving privacy and unbiased estimates.
Develop state of the art machine learning models, optimizing for the right objective.
Validate the offline performance of models and work in a Continuous Integration manner.
Deploy solutions for end users and help drive change in a Continuous Deployment manner.
Monitor model performance and business success metrics over time.

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar field. 2+ years of hands-on experience or similar post-grad work in Machine Learning.
Experience with machine learning development lifecycle and deep learning methods such as Transformers, GANs, DQN, VAE, SHAP, Counterfactuals and Adversarial examples etc.
Experience with Python and common machine learning/deep learning libraries Tensorflow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, huggingface etc.
Knowledge of big data ecosystem Hadoop/Spark. ML Cloud capabilities would be an asset.
Familiarity with collaborative software development tools (git, issue tracking) and *nix environments
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal) across peers and senior leaders

Nice to have
Strong knowledge machine learning application design. Experience deploying models into productions with MLOps (MlFlow, KubeFlow etc).
Experience in running A/B experiments in production. Experience with relational databases. Domain specific knowledge of marketing campaigns.
Experience in developing attrition models with proven success. Publications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Passion for ethical AI and experience in algorithm transparency and interpretability. Knowledge of banking data.

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Data Science
Job Description:
SoundHound Inc. builds voice AI products that make it easier for people to engage with the world around them. We do this by creating custom voice assistants that make it possible for companies to extend their brand in new and meaningful ways. Today, our customized voice AI solutions allow people to talk to phones, cars, smart speakers, mobile apps, coffee machines, and every other part of the emerging 'voice-first' world.

We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our Data Science and Engineering team. We aspire to leverage our data to steer product development, marketing and user engagement. We have only scratched the surface of the kind of advanced analytics and insight generation we'd like to do!

You will be able to work on some of the most challenging data science problems while building large-scale, distributed, machine learning systems from the ground up. You will also enjoy working with teammates who value creativity and collaboration.

In this role, you will:
Design and develop high-performance, data-driven systems in a distributed infrastructure

Build machine learning models for analysis of queries using NLP and deep learning techniques

Develop scalable components for query intent classification, entity detection, dialogue understanding, slot filling, and domain detection

Leverage massive datasets for modeling, recommendations, ad targeting and insight generation

Build and maintain knowledge graph of content from diverse data sources and perform data mining to serve high volume of requests

We would love to hear from you if:
You have at least five years of relevant industry experience

You possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline

You have extensive experience with classification systems, ranking systems, and predictive modeling

You write production-level code using Java, Python, or Scala

You can handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

You are passionate about using data and analytics to improve our voice AI products

We'd be especially excited if you have spent considerable time applying deep learning techniques to NLP.

Here at SoundHound, diversity, equity, and inclusion are key to who we are as a company. With a mission to build Voice AI for the world, creating a team with global perspectives is critical to our success.

We care deeply about fostering an environment where everyone is supported and can do their best work. SoundHound will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits of employment.

Employees enjoy comprehensive health care, paid time off, discounted fitness classes, and flexible working hours. Learn more about our philosophy, benefits, and culture at https://soundhound.com/careers/.

Come join our growing team and bring your unique voice to our mission!
